article_text:
Ted Cruz has a tongue-in-cheek ad out just in time for Christmas.

The Texas senator, seated with his wife and two daughters, highlights his colorful time so far in Congress by announcing the debut of some of his new books, "Told by the senator who once read 'Green Eggs and Ham' on the Senate floor."

His books include "How Obamacare Stole Christmas," and "Rudolph, The Underemployed Reindeer."

Stay abreast of the latest developments from nation's capital and beyond with curated News Alerts from the Washington Examiner news desk and delivered to your inbox.

article_metadata.description:
Ted Cruz has a tongue-in-cheek ad out just in time for Christmas.
The Texas senator, seated with his wife and two daughters, highlights his colorful time so far in Congress by announcing the debut of some of his new books, Told by the senator who once read 'Green Eggs and Ham' on the Senate floor.
His books include How Obamacare Stole Christmas, and Rudolph, The Underemployed Reindeer.
Cruz exclaims, All of the other reindeer couldn't afford to hire Rudolph!
Cruz then reads from Frosty, the Speaker of the House.
Look! The speaker is melting before Congress, Cruz says, feigning shock.
There is even The Grinch Who Lost Her Emails.
article_metadata.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 The Washington Examiner. All Rights Reserved
